definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Many Japanese regarded him as the ablest Chinese strategist alive.
sentences.chinese: 许多日本人都认为他是中国现有的最有才干的战略家。

sentences.english: The unique geo-strategic position has long attracted the attention of strategists from every part of the world.
sentences.chinese: 中国独特的地缘战略地位历来为各国战略家所重视。

sentences.english: Zhou Tieshan is the founder and strategist of a Chinese high-class website. In April 2002, Mr.
sentences.chinese: 周铁山先生是中国高端互联网的先行者和战略家。

sentences.english: Illustration by Jac DepczykEVERY financial crisis involves a tug of war between the tacticians and the strategists.
sentences.chinese: 每次金融危机的处理都会有战术家和战略家之争。

sentences.english: EVERY financial crisis involves a tug of war between the tacticians and the strategists.
sentences.chinese: 每次金融危机的处理都会有战术家和战略家之争。

sentences.english: EU strategists are already drawing up plans for a counter-offensive.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟的战略家们已经准备好绝地大反击了。

sentences.english: "The American strategists can sleep in peace, " he writes.
sentences.chinese: “美国战略家可以平静的入睡了，”他写道。

sentences.english: For Chinese strategists, however, the threats are still America and India.
sentences.chinese: 然而，中国的战略家们仍然认为威胁来自美国和印度。

definition: to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
variant of 開國元勳|开国元勋, founding figure (of country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company, school etc
founding figure (of a country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company or school etc
